headline: Many Mormon Women Feel Torn Between Equal Rights Proposal and Church; 'Now I Am Afraid' A Center of Life Opposed to Birth Control A Problem of All Women 'They Do Not Understand' In Pursuit of Careers Called a 'Communist Plan' Questions on Tax Status
snippet: SALT LAKE CITY, Nov. 25 For Mormon feminists, who began organizing in the early 1970's, and for more traditional Mormon women, the proposed equal rights amendment has been a source of pain and conflict.

headline: Africans Decide Islam Permits Birth Control
snippet: BANJUL, Gambia, Oct. 27 (Reuters) --Twelve African countries with large Islamic communities have agreed that Islam does not prohibit family planning.

headline: World News Briefs; Chad Leader Says Forces Routed Libyan Invaders Eight Are Executed in Iran; One Linked to Prostitution China Rehabilitates Backer Of Birth Control at Age 98 Soviet Asserts Peking Lied About Fatal Border Incident
Ireland's Birth Control Bill Stirs Rancorous Debate; Two Contrasting Messages
snippet: DUBLIN--Legislation to permit the sale of contraceptives in Ireland has started a rancorous national debate.

headline: Mexico's Birth-Control Effort Catching On; Working for the Next Century
snippet: TEPATETIPA, Mexico--For Domitila Sebastian, the Mexican Government's family-planning program has perhaps come too late. At the age of 40 Mrs. Sebastian has been pregnant 14 times and has 12 surviving children aged 1 to 22.

headline: Birth Control Urged To Cut Relief Costs; Birth Control Urged to Cut Welfare Costs
snippet: Gov Byrne's Comm on Budget Priorities, made up of businessmen, recommends that unwed welfare mothers be required to practice birth control; endorses idea of requiring mothers of dependent children to work; comm discusses advisibility of state law...

headline: India Sees Slowdown, Rise in Unemployment; Failure of Birth Control Need to Limit Population Seen
snippet: NEW DELHI, Feb. 23--India's economy has slowed despite a sharp increase in industrial production.

headline: Birth Control Parley Shaken as Protesters Display Two Fetuses
snippet: WASHINGTON, Feb. 15--A peacemaking effort by opposing sides of the abortion issue to establish common ground on alternative means of birth control suffered a sharp setback today when three women interrupted a news conference and displayed two human...

headline: Visitors Say Chinese Report They Have a Safe and Effective Birth Control Pill for Men; 'Other Occasions' Cited
snippet: ANN ARBOR, Mich., Jan. 5 (AP)  Chinese scientists say that they have developed the first safe and effective birthcontrol pill for men, it was reported here today.
